value.title: Specifying multiple filter conditions in CALCULATE
value.excerpt: The filter arguments in CALCULATE can reference multiple columns from the same table in a single predicate: This is possible since March 2021 in Power BI, before that it was possible to filter a single column reference.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/705207?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

topItems.title: Previous year up to a certain date
topItems.excerpt: This video describes how to compute previous year values up to a certain date in DAX and Power BI. This technique is useful in case the data is presenting incomplete months or years. Article and download: https://sql.bi/352723?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive

topItems.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX
topItems.excerpt: Variables in DAX are constants, and this could be very confusing! Watch this video to understand how the evaluation of variables works in DAX. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/

topItems.title: Year-to-date filtering weekdays in DAX
topItems.excerpt: Time intelligence functions oftentimes hide an automatic ALL statement meant to make time intelligence calculations easier. This video describes this behavior and what to do in case it ends up breaking your calculation. Article and download: https://sql.bi/123591

value.title: Design a data¬†model¬†in Power BI¬†
value.excerpt: The process of creating a complicated data model in Power BI is straightforward. If your data is coming in from more than one transactional system, before you know it, you can have dozens of tables that you have to work with. Building a great data model is about simplifying the disarray. A star schema is one way to simplify a data model, and you‚Äôll learn about the terminology and implementation of them in this module. You will also learn about why choosing the correct data granularity is important for performance and usability of your Power BI reports. Finally, you‚Äôll learn about improving performance with your Power BI data models.

value.title: Avoid the full refresh with Incremental Refresh in Power BI (Premium)
value.excerpt: Is the full refresh of Incremental Refresh taking a long time? Or, even timing out? Patrick shows you how you can avoid the full refresh and refresh each partition individually when using Power BI Premium!  Handling deletes within Incremental Refresh in Power BI: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nKVrl0ec6uE

value.title: Dynamically change chart axis in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick builds on a blog post from Scott Senkeresty to dynamically change the axis of your visual within Power BI. This uses a combination of Power Query and DAX.  Chris Cook - @Finalyst89  Scott Senkeresty ‚Äì @ScottSenkeresty  Dynamically changing chart axis http://tinylizard.com/dynamically-changing-chart-axis/

value.title: Embedding with Power BI - What's the difference?
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at the differences between the two embedding options with Power BI. We get a lot of questions about what steps need to be taken, what Capacity SKUs are needed and where can they be used.
